topic_or_construct: willingness to wait for delayed rewards
measured_by: Area Under the Kaplan-Meier Survival Curve (AUC) derived from the persistence task
justification: "To operationalize individual differences in persistence, we constructed a Kaplan-Meier survival curve for each participant… The area under the survival curve (AUC) is a useful summary statistic, representing the average number of seconds an individual was willing to wait."

The authors state that "rapid phasic pupil dilation occurs in response to surprising events" and focus their analyses on "phasic pupil responses (post-outcome) … as a physiological marker of surprise."

"Pupil diameter measured during engagement with a task is associated with cognitive effort… we also examined ‘pre-decision’ pupil diameter just prior to quit decisions" to index effort involved in those decisions.
After the task, participants completed "a computerized intertemporal choice questionnaire" which assesses discounting of delayed rewards.
Participants completed "the Rotter locus of control questionnaire," a standard instrument for measuring perceived control over reinforcement.
The methods list the "Alcohol Use Disorders Identification Test" administered to assess alcohol-related problems.
The article notes administration of "the Drug Abuse Screening Test" to evaluate drug misuse.
Participants also completed "the Fagerstrom Test for Nicotine Dependence" to gauge tobacco dependence.
